name: Croatian Alphabet & Pronunciation
rule_description:
## 30 Letters - One Sound Each

| Letter | Sound | Example |
|--------|-------|--------|
| **č** | ch (church) | **č**aj (tea) |
| **ć** | soft ch (tune) | **ć**evapi |
| **š** | sh (ship) | **š**kola (school) |
| **ž** | zh (measure) | **ž**ena (woman) |
| **đ** | soft j (juice) | **đ**ak (student) |
| **dž** | hard j (jam) | d**ž**ep (pocket) |
| **lj** | ly (million) | **lj**ubav (love) |
| **nj** | ny (canyon) | **nj**ega (him) |

**Key Rule:** Every letter = one sound. No silent letters. Stress usually on first syllable.

name: Personal Pronouns
rule_description:
## Personal Pronouns (Nominative)

| Person | Singular | Plural |
|--------|----------|--------|
| 1st | **ja** (I) | **mi** (we) |
| 2nd | **ti** (you) | **vi** (you/formal) |
| 3rd m. | **on** (he) | **oni** (they m.) |
| 3rd f. | **ona** (she) | **one** (they f.) |
| 3rd n. | **ono** (it) | **ona** (they n.) |

**Note:** *Vi* = formal "you" (singular) OR plural "you"

name: Noun Gender Recognition
rule_description:
## Gender by Ending

| Gender | Typical Ending | Examples |
|--------|---------------|----------|
| **Masculine** | consonant | grad, student, prozor |
| **Feminine** | **-a** | žena, škola, knjiga |
| **Neuter** | **-o** / **-e** | selo, more, dijete |

### Exceptions to Memorize
- **-a** but masculine: tata, kolega, sudija
- Natural gender wins: *žena* (woman) = feminine regardless

name: Nominative Case (Subject)
rule_description:
## Nominative = Subject (Who/What?)

**Word Order:** Subject + Verb + Object

| Question | Answer |
|----------|--------|
| Tko? (Who?) | **Student** čita. |
| Što? (What?) | **Knjiga** je tu. |

### Basic Pattern
```
[SUBJECT-nom] + [VERB] + [rest]
Marko         radi      svaki dan.
Žena          kuha      večeru.
```

**Dictionary form = Nominative**

name: Present Tense: "Biti" (To Be)
rule_description:
## Biti (To Be) - Present Tense

| Person | Full Form | Short Form |
|--------|-----------|------------|
| ja | jesam | **sam** |
| ti | jesi | **si** |
| on/ona/ono | jest | **je** |
| mi | jesmo | **smo** |
| vi | jeste | **ste** |
| oni/one/ona | jesu | **su** |

### Negation
| Person | Negative |
|--------|----------|
| ja | **nisam** |
| ti | **nisi** |
| on/ona | **nije** |
| mi | **nismo** |
| vi | **niste** |
| oni | **nisu** |

**Use short forms in statements, full forms for emphasis/questions**

name: Present Tense: Regular -ati Verbs
rule_description:
## -ati Verbs → -am Pattern

| Person | Ending | Example: raditi |
|--------|--------|----------------|
| ja | **-am** | rad**im** |
| ti | **-aš** | rad**iš** |
| on/ona | **-a** | rad**i** |
| mi | **-amo** | rad**imo** |
| vi | **-ate** | rad**ite** |
| oni | **-aju** | rad**e** |

### Common -ati Verbs
- im**ati** (have) → imam, imaš...
- pit**ati** (ask) → pitam, pitaš...
- gled**ati** (watch) → gledam, gledaš...
- čit**ati** (read) → čitam, čitaš...

**Formula:** Remove -ti, add endings

name: Present Tense: Regular -iti Verbs
rule_description:
## -iti Verbs → -im Pattern

| Person | Ending | Example: govoriti |
|--------|--------|------------------|
| ja | **-im** | govor**im** |
| ti | **-iš** | govor**iš** |
| on/ona | **-i** | govor**i** |
| mi | **-imo** | govor**imo** |
| vi | **-ite** | govor**ite** |
| oni | **-e** | govor**e** |

### Common -iti Verbs
- govor**iti** (speak) → govorim
- rad**iti** (work) → radim
- uč**iti** (learn) → učim
- misliti (think) → mislim

**Note:** 3rd pl. ends in **-e**, not -iju

name: Present Tense: Regular -eti Verbs
rule_description:
## -eti/-jeti Verbs → -im Pattern

| Person | Ending | Example: vidjeti |
|--------|--------|------------------|
| ja | **-im** | vid**im** |
| ti | **-iš** | vid**iš** |
| on/ona | **-i** | vid**i** |
| mi | **-imo** | vid**imo** |
| vi | **-ite** | vid**ite** |
| oni | **-e** | vid**e** |

### Common -eti Verbs
- vidj**eti** (see) → vidim
- razumj**eti** (understand) → razumijem
- živj**eti** (live) → živim
- volj**eti** (love) → volim

**Watch for stem changes:** vidjeti → vid- (drop -je-)

name: Accusative Case (Direct Object)
rule_description:
## Accusative = Direct Object (Whom/What?)

| Gender | Nom → Acc | Example |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| Masc. animate | -ø → **-a** | student → student**a** |
| Masc. inanimate | **no change** | grad → grad |
| Feminine | -a → **-u** | žena → žen**u** |
| Neuter | **no change** | selo → selo |

### Pattern
```
[Subject] + [Verb] + [Object-ACC]
Ja         vidim     student-a.    (I see the student)
On         čita      knjig-u.      (He reads a book)
Mi         volimo    grad.         (We love the city)
```

**Key:** Only masculine ANIMATE and feminine change!

name: Basic Questions
rule_description:
## Question Words

| Croatian | English | Example |
|----------|---------|--------|
| **Tko?** | Who? | Tko je to? |
| **Što?** | What? | Što radiš? |
| **Gdje?** | Where? | Gdje živiš? |
| **Kada?** | When? | Kada dolaziš? |
| **Kako?** | How? | Kako si? |
| **Zašto?** | Why? | Zašto učiš? |
| **Koliko?** | How much/many? | Koliko košta? |
| **Koji?** | Which? | Koji film? |

### Yes/No Questions
- Add **li** after verb: **Govoriš li** engleski?
- Or use **Da li**: **Da li** govoriš engleski?
- Or just intonation: Govoriš engleski?

name: Negation
rule_description:
## Negation with NE

**ne + verb** (written together for biti)

| Positive | Negative |
|----------|----------|
| radim | **ne** radim |
| govorim | **ne** govorim |
| jesam | **nisam** |
| imam | **nemam** |

### Negative Pronouns
| Positive | Negative |
|----------|----------|
| netko (someone) | **nitko** (no one) |
| nešto (something) | **ništa** (nothing) |
| negdje (somewhere) | **nigdje** (nowhere) |
| nekad (sometime) | **nikad** (never) |

**Double negative required:**
- Nitko **ne** dolazi. (Nobody is coming)
- **Ne** vidim **ništa**. (I don't see anything)

name: Cardinal Numbers 0-100
rule_description:
## Numbers 0-20

| # | Croatian | # | Croatian |
|---|----------|---|----------|
| 0 | nula | 11 | jedanaest |
| 1 | jedan | 12 | dvanaest |
| 2 | dva | 13 | trinaest |
| 3 | tri | 14 | četrnaest |
| 4 | četiri | 15 | petnaest |
| 5 | pet | 16 | šesnaest |
| 6 | šest | 17 | sedamnaest |
| 7 | sedam | 18 | osamnaest |
| 8 | osam | 19 | devetnaest |
| 9 | devet | 20 | dvadeset |
| 10 | deset | | |

## Tens & Pattern
| # | Croatian |

| 40 | četrdeset |

**21-99:** dvadeset **i** jedan (20 and 1)

name: Basic Adjective Agreement
rule_description:
## Adjective Agrees with Noun

| Gender | Ending | Example |
|--------|--------|--------|
| Masculine | -ø / -i | velik**i** grad |
| Feminine | **-a** | velik**a** kuća |
| Neuter | **-o** / **-e** | velik**o** selo |

### Definite vs Indefinite
| Type | Masc. | Fem. | Neut. |
|------|-------|------|-------|
| Indefinite | nov | nova | novo |
| Definite | nov**i** | nov**a** | nov**o** |

**Definite (-i form):** specific/known item
**Indefinite:** general/unknown

```
Lijep dan. (A nice day - indefinite)
Lijepi dan. (The nice day - definite)
```

name: Possessive Pronouns
rule_description:
## Possessive Pronouns

| Owner | Masc. | Fem. | Neut. |
|-------|-------|------|-------|
| ja | **moj** | moj**a** | moj**e** |
| ti | **tvoj** | tvoj**a** | tvoj**e** |
| on | **njegov** | njegov**a** | njegovo |
| ona | **njezin** | njezin**a** | njezin**o** |
| mi | **naš** | naš**a** | naš**e** |
| vi | **vaš** | vaš**a** | vaš**e** |
| oni | **njihov** | njihov**a** | njihov**o** |

### Agreement Rule
Matches the **possessed noun**, NOT the owner:
- **Njegov**a kuća (His house) - feminine
- **Njezin** auto (Her car) - masculine

name: Demonstratives
rule_description:
## Demonstrative Pronouns

| Distance | Masc. | Fem. | Neut. |
|----------|-------|------|-------|
| Near (this) | **ovaj** | ov**a** | ov**o** |
| Medium (that) | **taj** | t**a** | t**o** |
| Far (that over there) | **onaj** | on**a** | on**o** |

### Usage
```
ovaj čovjek - this man (near me)
taj čovjek - that man (near you)
onaj čovjek - that man (far from both)
```

**Plural:**
| Distance | Masc. | Fem. | Neut. |
|----------|-------|------|-------|
| Near | ovi | ove | ova |
| Medium | ti | te | ta |
| Far | oni | one | ona |

name: Genitive Case (Possession/Negation)
rule_description:
## Genitive = Possession/Of (Whose? Of what?)

| Gender | Nom → Gen | Example |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| Masculine | -ø → **-a** | grad → grad**a** |
| Feminine | -a → **-e** | žena → žen**e** |
| Neuter | -o/-e → **-a** | selo → sel**a** |

### Key Uses
1. **Possession:** kuća mog**a** oca (my father's house)
2. **After nema:** Nema vremen**a**. (There's no time)
3. **Quantities:** čaša vod**e** (glass of water)
4. **After prepositions:** iz grad**a**, do škol**e**, bez novac**a**

### Prepositions + Genitive
| Prep | Meaning | Example |
|------|---------|--------|
| iz | from/out of | iz kuće |
| do | to/until | do škole |
| od | from | od prijatelja |
| bez | without | bez novca |
| kod | at (someone's) | kod doktora |

name: Dative Case (Indirect Object)
rule_description:
## Dative = To Whom? For Whom?

| Gender | Nom → Dat | Example |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| Masculine | -ø → **-u** | student → student**u** |
| Feminine | -a → **-i** | žena → žen**i** |
| Neuter | -o/-e → **-u** | dijete → djetet**u** |

### Key Uses
1. **Indirect object:** Dajem knjig**u** student**u**. (I give the book to the student)
2. **Verbs requiring dative:**
   - pomoći + DAT (help)
   - reći + DAT (tell)
   - dati + DAT (give)
   - trebati + DAT (need)

### Pattern
```
[Subj] + [Verb] + [Direct Obj-ACC] + [Indirect Obj-DAT]
Dajem      knjig-u              prijatelj-u.
```

**Memory:** Dative answers "to whom/for whom"

name: Locative Case (Location)
rule_description:
## Locative = Location (Where? About what?)

| Gender | Nom → Loc | Example |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| Masculine | -ø → **-u** | grad → grad**u** |
| Feminine | -a → **-i** | škola → škol**i** |
| Neuter | -o/-e → **-u** | selo → sel**u** |

### ALWAYS with Preposition
| Prep | Meaning | Example |
|------|---------|--------|
| **u** | in | u grad**u** (in the city) |
| **na** | on/at | na stol**u** (on the table) |
| **o** | about | o poslu (about work) |
| **pri** | near/at | pri ruci (at hand) |

### Loc vs Acc Motion Rule
| Question | Case | Example |
|----------|------|--------|
| Where? (static) | LOC | Živim **u** grad**u**. |
| Where to? (motion) | ACC | Idem **u** grad. |

**Same endings as Dative!**

name: Instrumental Case (Means/Accompaniment)
rule_description:
## Instrumental = With What/Whom? By What Means?

| Gender | Nom → Instr | Example |
|--------|-------------|--------|
| Masculine | -ø → **-om/-em** | auto → aut**om** |
| Feminine | -a → **-om** | ruka → ruk**om** |
| Neuter | -o/-e → **-om/-em** | pero → per**om** |

### Key Uses
1. **With (accompaniment):** Idem **s** prijatelj**em**. (I go with a friend)
2. **By means of:** Pišem olovk**om**. (I write with a pencil)
3. **Transport:** Putujem vlak**om**. (I travel by train)

### S/SA + Instrumental
- **s** before consonants: s bratom
- **sa** before s/š/z/ž: sa sestrom

### Common Expressions
- s vremenom (with time)
- jednom riječju (in one word)
- putem (by way of)

name: Vocative Case (Address)
rule_description:
## Vocative = Direct Address

| Gender | Nom → Voc | Example |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| Masc. -ø | → **-e/-u** | Marko → Mark**o**! |
| Masc. -a | → **-o** | tata → tat**o**! |
| Feminine | → **-o/-e** | Ana → An**o**! |
| Neuter | no change | dijete → dijete! |

### Patterns
| Ending | Vocative | Example |
|--------|----------|--------|
| -k, -g, -h | **-u** (+ softening) | drug → druže! |
| -ac | **-če** | momak → momče! |
| other cons. | **-e** | student → studente! |

### Usage
- Calling someone: **Ivane!** Dođi ovamo!
- Often with exclamation: **Bože moj!** (My God!)
- Common: **Gospođo!** (Ma'am!), **Gospodine!** (Sir!)

name: Plural Nouns (All Cases)
rule_description:
## Plural Endings by Case

### Masculine
| Case | Singular | Plural |
|------|----------|--------|
| Nom | grad | grad**ovi** |
| Gen | grada | grad**ova** |
| Dat | gradu | grad**ovima** |
| Acc | grad | grad**ove** |
| Loc | gradu | grad**ovima** |
| Ins | gradom | grad**ovima** |

### Feminine (-a)
| Case | Singular | Plural |
|------|----------|--------|
| Nom | žena | žen**e** |
| Gen | žene | žen**a** |
| Dat | ženi | žen**ama** |
| Acc | ženu | žen**e** |
| Loc | ženi | žen**ama** |
| Ins | ženom | žen**ama** |

### Neuter
| Case | Singular | Plural |
|------|----------|--------|
| Nom | selo | sel**a** |
| Gen | sela | sel**a** |
| Dat/Loc/Ins | selu | sel**ima** |

name: Adjective Declension (All Cases)
rule_description:
## Adjective Endings (Definite Form)

### Masculine Singular
| Case | Ending | Example: novi |
|------|--------|---------------|
| Nom | -i | nov**i** |
| Gen | -og(a) | nov**og** |
| Dat/Loc | -om(u) | nov**om** |
| Acc (anim) | -og(a) | nov**og** |
| Acc (inanim) | -i | nov**i** |
| Ins | -im | nov**im** |

### Feminine Singular
| Case | Ending | Example: nova |
|------|--------|---------------|
| Nom | -a | nov**a** |
| Gen | -e | nov**e** |
| Dat/Loc | -oj | nov**oj** |
| Acc | -u | nov**u** |
| Ins | -om | nov**om** |

### Neuter: Like masc. except Nom/Acc = **-o/-e**

**Rule:** Adjective matches noun in gender, number, AND case

name: Past Tense (Perfekt)
rule_description:
## Perfekt = Auxiliary + L-Participle

### Formula
**sam/si/je/smo/ste/su** + **-o/-la/-lo/-li/-le/-la**

### L-Participle by Gender
| Gender | Singular | Plural |
|--------|----------|--------|
| Masc. | radi**o** | radi**li** |
| Fem. | radi**la** | radi**le** |
| Neut. | radi**lo** | radi**la** |

### Full Conjugation: raditi (to work)
| Person | Form |
|--------|------|
| ja (m/f) | **sam** radio / radila |
| ti (m/f) | **si** radio / radila |
| on | **je** radio |
| ona | **je** radila |
| mi | **smo** radili |
| vi | **ste** radili |
| oni | **su** radili |

### Negation
**nisam/nisi/nije...** + L-participle

name: Future Tense (Simple)
rule_description:
## Future I = htjeti + Infinitive

### Short Forms of Htjeti
| Person | Short | Full |
|--------|-------|------|
| ja | **ću** | hoću |
| ti | **ćeš** | hoćeš |
| on/ona | **će** | hoće |
| mi | **ćemo** | hoćemo |
| vi | **ćete** | hoćete |
| oni | **će** | hoće |

### Two Patterns
1. **Infinitive + short form:** Raditi **ću**.
2. **Short form + infinitive:** **Ću** raditi. → **Radit ću** (drop -i)

### Examples
| Croatian | English |
|----------|--------|
| Radit ću. | I will work. |
| Ići ćemo. | We will go. |
| Neću raditi. | I won't work. |

### Negation
**neću/nećeš/neće/nećemo/nećete/neće** + infinitive

name: Reflexive Verbs
rule_description:
## Reflexive = Verb + SE

### SE Position
Never first! Usually after first stressed word.

| Correct | Incorrect |
|---------|----------|
| Ja **se** zovem Ana. | ~~Se zovem Ana.~~ |
| Kako **se** zoveš? | |
| Zovem **se** Ana. | |

### Common Reflexive Verbs
| Croatian | English |
|----------|--------|
| zvati **se** | to be called |
| osjećati **se** | to feel |
| bojati **se** | to be afraid |
| smijati **se** | to laugh |
| nadati **se** | to hope |
| sjećati **se** | to remember |
| truditi **se** | to try |

### Types
1. **True reflexive:** umivati se (wash oneself)
2. **Reciprocal:** voljeti se (love each other)
3. **Inherently reflexive:** bojati se (no non-reflexive form)

name: Aspect: Perfective vs Imperfective
rule_description:
## Aspect = Completed vs Ongoing

| Aspect | Focus | Example |
|--------|-------|--------|
| **Imperfective** | process, duration, repetition | pisati (write - ongoing) |
| **Perfective** | completion, result, single event | napisati (write - complete) |

### Aspect Pairs
| Imperfective | Perfective | Meaning |
|--------------|------------|--------|
| pisati | **na**pisati | write |
| čitati | **pro**čitati | read |
| raditi | **na**raditi | work/make |
| učiti | **na**učiti | learn |
| gledati | **po**gledati | look/watch |

### Usage
| Context | Use | Example |
|---------|-----|--------|
| Was doing (process) | Imperf. | Pisao sam pismo. |
| Did (completed) | Perf. | Napisao sam pismo. |
| Will do (once) | Perf. | Napisat ću. |
| Used to do | Imperf. | Pisao sam svaki dan. |

name: Modal Verbs
rule_description:
## Modal Verbs + Infinitive

### Moći (can/be able)
| Person | Present |
|--------|--------|
| ja | **mogu** |
| ti | **možeš** |
| on/ona | **može** |
| mi | **možemo** |
| vi | **možete** |
| oni | **mogu** |

### Other Modals
| Modal | Meaning | Example |
|-------|---------|--------|
| **htjeti** | want | Hoću ići. |
| **trebati** | need/should | Trebam raditi. |
| **morati** | must | Moram ići. |
| **smjeti** | may/be allowed | Smijem ući? |
| **željeti** | wish | Želim naučiti. |

### Pattern
**Modal (conjugated)** + **Infinitive**
- Mogu **govoriti** hrvatski.
- Moraš **učiti** svaki dan.

name: Comparatives
rule_description:
## Comparative = More...

### Regular Pattern: -iji / -ji
| Positive | Comparative | Pattern |
|----------|-------------|--------|
| star (old) | star**iji** | + iji |
| mlad (young) | mlađ**i** | + i (softening) |
| velik (big) | već**i** | + i (softening) |
| brz (fast) | brž**i** | + i |

### Irregular Comparatives
| Positive | Comparative |
|----------|-------------|
| dobar (good) | **bolji** |
| loš (bad) | **gori** |
| velik (big) | **veći** |
| mali (small) | **manji** |

### Comparison Structure
**[Subj] + je + [Comp] + od + [Gen]** OR **nego + [Nom]**
- On je stariji **od** mene.
- On je stariji **nego** ja.

### Softening Before -i
k→č, g→ž, h→š: velik → već**i**

name: Superlatives
rule_description:
## Superlative = NAJ- + Comparative

### Formation
| Positive | Comparative | Superlative |
|----------|-------------|-------------|
| star | stariji | **naj**stariji |
| mlad | mlađi | **naj**mlađi |
| velik | veći | **naj**veći |
| dobar | bolji | **naj**bolji |
| loš | gori | **naj**gori |

### Examples
| Croatian | English |
|----------|--------|
| najveći grad | the biggest city |
| najbolji prijatelj | the best friend |
| najljepša žena | the most beautiful woman |

### Usage
- On je **najbolji** student.
- To je **najskuplji** restoran u gradu.
- Zagreb je **najveći** grad u Hrvatskoj.

**Note:** Superlative declines like any adjective

name: Prepositions with Cases
rule_description:
## Case Government by Preposition

### Genitive
| Prep | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| iz | from (inside) |
| s(a) | from (surface) |
| do | to, until |
| od | from |
| bez | without |
| kod | at (someone's) |
| ispred/iza | in front/behind |

### Dative
| Prep | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| k(a) | toward |
| prema | toward |
| unatoč | despite |

### Accusative
| Prep | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| u | into |
| na | onto |
| za | for |
| kroz | through |

### Locative (ALWAYS needs preposition)
| Prep | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| u | in |
| na | on |
| o | about |

### Motion Rule
| Static (LOC) | Motion (ACC) |
|--------------|-------------|
| u gradu (in) | u grad (into) |
| na stolu (on) | na stol (onto) |

name: Conjunctions
rule_description:
## Common Conjunctions

### Coordinating
| Conj | Meaning | Example |
|------|---------|--------|
| **i** | and | Ivan i Ana |
| **a** | and/but (contrast) | On radi, a ja odmaram. |
| **ali** | but | Dobar, ali skup. |
| **ili** | or | Kava ili čaj? |
| **ni...ni** | neither...nor | Ni on ni ona. |

### Subordinating
| Conj | Meaning | Example |
|------|---------|--------|
| **da** | that | Mislim da je dobro. |
| **jer** | because | Idem jer moram. |
| **ako** | if | Ako dođeš... |
| **kad(a)** | when | Kad dođem... |
| **dok** | while | Dok čekam... |
| **iako** | although | Iako je kasno... |

### Word Order
After **da, jer, ako, kad**: normal word order

name: Telling Time
rule_description:

name: Verb Aspect in Depth
rule_description:
## Aspect Pair Formation

### Common Prefixes (Imperf → Perf)
| Prefix | Meaning | Example |
|--------|---------|--------|
| **na-** | completion | pisati → **na**pisati |
| **pro-** | through | čitati → **pro**čitati |

| -iti → -ivati | kupiti → kup**ovati** |
| -ati → -avati | dati → dav**ati** |
| -nuti → -ati | skinuti → skid**ati** |

### Suppletive Pairs (Different Roots)

| govoriti | reći |
| gledati | vidjeti |
| stavljati | staviti |

name: Past Tense Aspect Usage
rule_description:
## Choosing Aspect in Past

### Imperfective Past
| Use | Example |
|-----|--------|
| Ongoing action | Pisao **sam** pismo. (was writing) |
| Repeated action | Pisao sam svaki dan. (used to write) |
| Background | Dok sam čitao... (while reading) |
| No result focus | Čitao sam knjigu. (was reading) |

### Perfective Past
| Use | Example |
|-----|--------|
| Completed action | **Napisao** sam pismo. (wrote/finished) |
| Single event | Pročitao sam članak. (read it) |
| Result emphasis | Naučio sam hrvatski. (learned it) |
| Sequence | Došao je i sjeo. (came and sat) |

### Contrast
| Imperfective | Perfective |
|--------------|------------|
| Pisao sam. (was writing) | Napisao sam. (wrote it) |
| Čitao sam knjigu. | Pročitao sam knjigu. |
| Učio sam godinama. | Naučio sam. |

name: Future Tense Aspect Usage
rule_description:
## Choosing Aspect in Future

### Imperfective Future
| Use | Example |
|-----|--------|
| Ongoing/duration | Radit ću cijeli dan. |
| Repeated action | Pisati ću svaki dan. |
| Process focus | Učit ću hrvatski. |

### Perfective Future
| Use | Example |
|-----|--------|
| Single completed | Napisat ću pismo. |
| Result expected | Naučit ću to. |
| Promise/intention | Napravit ću to sutra. |

### Common Pairs in Future
| Imperfective | Perfective |
|--------------|------------|
| Ću pisati. (will be writing) | Napisat ću. (will write) |
| Ću čitati. (will read/be reading) | Pročitat ću. (will have read) |
| Ću učiti. (will study) | Naučit ću. (will learn) |

**Rule:** Perfective = single complete action; Imperfective = process/duration

name: Aorist & Imperfekt (Recognition)
rule_description:
## Literary Past Tenses (Passive Recognition)

### Aorist (Perfective Past - Literary)
| Person | Ending | Example: reći |
|--------|--------|---------------|
| ja | -h | rek**oh** |
| ti | -ø | reč**e** |
| on | -ø | reč**e** |
| mi | -smo | rek**osmo** |
| vi | -ste | rek**oste** |
| oni | -še | rek**oše** |

### Imperfekt (Imperfective Past - Literary)
| Person | Ending | Example: govoriti |
|--------|--------|-------------------|
| ja | -ah | govor**ah** |
| ti | -aše | govor**aše** |
| on | -aše | govor**aše** |
| mi | -asmo | govor**asmo** |
| vi | -aste | govor**aste** |
| oni | -ahu | govor**ahu** |

**Usage:** Found in literature, folk tales, some dialects. Not used in everyday speech.

name: Conditional Mood
rule_description:
## Conditional = bih + L-Participle

### Formation
| Person | Auxiliary | + L-Participle |
|--------|-----------|----------------|
| ja | **bih** | radio/radila |
| ti | **bi** | radio/radila |
| on/ona | **bi** | radio/radila |
| mi | **bismo** | radili |
| vi | **biste** | radili |
| oni | **bi** | radili |

### Uses
| Type | Example |
|------|--------|
| Wish | **Htio bih** kavu. (I'd like coffee) |
| Polite request | **Biste li** mi pomogli? (Would you help?) |
| Hypothetical | **Kupio bih** to. (I would buy it) |
| If-clause result | Ako bi došao, **vidio bi**. |

### Negation
**ne bih / ne bi / ne bismo / ne biste / ne bi**

### Word Order
- Bih usually in 2nd position
- **Da** + conditional: Da bih mogao...

name: Imperative Mood
rule_description:
## Imperative = Commands

### Formation from Present Stem
| Verb Type | Ti | Vi/Mi |
|-----------|-----|-------|
| -am verbs | čitaj | čitaj**te** / čitaj**mo** |
| -im verbs | govori | govor**ite** / govor**imo** |
| -em verbs | piši | piš**ite** / piš**imo** |

### Common Imperatives
| Infinitive | Ti | Vi |
|------------|-----|-----|
| ići | **idi** | idite |
| doći | **dođi** | dođite |
| reći | **reci** | recite |
| jesti | **jedi** | jedite |
| biti | **budi** | budite |

### Negative Imperative
**nemoj** + infinitive (ti) / **nemojte** + infinitive (vi)
- **Nemoj** raditi to!
- **Nemojte** kasniti!

OR: **ne** + imperative (more emphatic)
- **Ne** radi to!

name: Passive Voice
rule_description:
## Passive = biti + Passive Participle

### Passive Participle Formation
| Infinitive | Participle (m/f/n) |
|------------|--------------------|
| pisati | pisan / pisana / pisano |
| raditi | rađen / rađena / rađeno |
| napraviti | napravljen / -a / -o |
| vidjeti | viđen / viđena / viđeno |

### Tense Formation
| Tense | Example |
|-------|--------|
| Present | Knjiga **je pisana**. |
| Past | Knjiga **je bila pisana**. |
| Future | Knjiga **će biti pisana**. |

### Agent (by whom)
**od strane** + Genitive (formal)
- Knjiga je napisana **od strane autora**.

OR omit agent (common)
- Zgrada je sagrađena 1990.

### Alternative: SE-Passive
**Tu se govori hrvatski.** (Croatian is spoken here)

name: Relative Clauses
rule_description:
## Relative Pronouns

### Koji/Koja/Koje (who/which/that)
| Antecedent | Relative | Example |
|------------|----------|--------|
| Masc. | **koji** | Čovjek **koji** radi... |
| Fem. | **koja** | Žena **koja** govori... |
| Neut. | **koje** | Dijete **koje** spava... |

### Case Agreement
Relative pronoun takes case from its role in the clause:
- Čovjek **kojeg** (ACC) vidim...
- Žena **kojoj** (DAT) dajem...
- Kuća u **kojoj** (LOC) živim...

### Other Relatives
| Word | Usage |
|------|-------|
| **što** | that (informal for koji) |
| **tko** | whoever |
| **gdje** | where |
| **kad(a)** | when |
| **kako** | how |

### Example Sentences
- To je knjiga **koju** čitam.
- Grad **u kojem** živim je lijep.

name: Indirect Speech
rule_description:
## Reported Speech

### Structure
**Main verb** + **da** + **clause**

### Direct → Indirect
| Direct | Indirect |
|--------|----------|
| "Dolazim." | Rekao je **da dolazi**. |
| "Došao sam." | Rekao je **da je došao**. |
| "Doći ću." | Rekao je **da će doći**. |

### Pronoun Shifts
| Direct | Indirect |
|--------|----------|
| ja → | on/ona |
| ti → | ja (if I'm addressed) |
| moj → | njegov/njezin |

### Tense (Usually NO Shift)
| Direct | Indirect |
|--------|----------|
| Present → | Present |
| Past → | Past |
| Future → | Future |

### Questions in Indirect Speech
- "Gdje ideš?" → Pitao me **gdje idem**.
- "Ideš li?" → Pitao me **idem li** / **da li idem**.

name: Verbal Nouns (Glagolske imenice)
rule_description:
## Verbal Noun = -anje / -enje / -je

### Formation
| Verb Type | Ending | Example |
|-----------|--------|--------|
| -ati verbs | **-anje** | čitati → čit**anje** |
| -iti verbs | **-enje** | učiti → uč**enje** |
| -eti verbs | **-enje** | vidjeti → vič**enje** |
| Other | **-je** | piti → pit**je** |

### Common Verbal Nouns
| Verb | Verbal Noun |
|------|-------------|
| pisati | pisanje (writing) |
| čitati | čitanje (reading) |
| učiti | učenje (learning) |
| plivati | plivanje (swimming) |
| trčati | trčanje (running) |

### Usage
- **Čitanje** je važno. (Reading is important)
- Volim **plivanje**. (I love swimming)
- Hvala na **razumijevanju**. (Thanks for understanding)

**Neuter gender, declines as neuter noun**

name: Participles: Present Active
rule_description:
## Present Active Participle = -ući / -eći

### Formation (from 3rd pl. present)
| 3rd Pl. | Participle | Meaning |
|---------|------------|--------|
| čitaju → | čitaj**ući** | while reading |
| govore → | govor**eći** | while speaking |
| pišu → | piš**ući** | while writing |
| rade → | rad**eći** | while working |

### Usage
Expresses simultaneous action (while doing X):

- **Čitajući** novine, pio je kavu.
  (While reading the paper, he drank coffee)
- **Hodajući** ulicom, vidio sam ga.
  (While walking down the street, I saw him)

### Important Notes
- Subject of participle = subject of main verb
- Invariable (doesn't decline)
- More common in written Croatian
- Equivalent to English "-ing" in some contexts

name: Participles: Past Passive
rule_description:
## Past Passive Participle = -n/-t + gender

### Formation
| Infinitive | Masc | Fem | Neut |
|------------|------|-----|------|
| napisati | napisa**n** | napisana | napisano |
| pročitati | pročita**n** | pročitana | pročitano |
| vidjeti | viđe**n** | viđena | viđeno |
| uzeti | uze**t** | uzeta | uzeto |
| napraviti | napravlje**n** | -a | -o |

### Uses
1. **Passive voice:** Pismo je **napisano**.
2. **Adjective:** **Napisana** knjiga. (written book)
3. **Result state:** Vrata su **otvorena**. (The door is open)

### Consonant Changes
| Before -en | Change |
|------------|--------|
| d → đ | vidjeti → vi**đ**en |
| t → ć | platiti → pla**ć**en |
| s → š | nositi → no**š**en |
| z → ž | voziti → vo**ž**en |

name: Diminutives & Augmentatives
rule_description:
## Diminutives (Small/Cute)

### Common Suffixes

|--------|--------|
| **-ić** (m) | pas → ps**ić** (doggy) |
| **-ica** (f) | kuća → kuć**ica** (little house) |
| **-ce** (n) | selo → sel**ce** (little village) |
| **-ak** (m) | list → list**ak** (leaflet) |

### Examples

| sestra | sestrica |

| **-etina** | ruka → ruč**etina** (big hand) |
| **-urina** | pas → ps**urina** (big dog) |

**Note:** Often carries emotional connotation (affection/contempt)

rule_description:
## Verb Prefixes

|--------|---------|--------|
| **do-** | to, completion | doći (come to) |
| **iz-** | out | izaći (go out) |
| **na-** | on, onto | napisati (write down) |
| **o-/ob-** | around | obići (go around) |
| **od-** | away | otići (go away) |
| **po-** | begin, a bit | početi (begin) |
| **pre-** | over, across | preći (cross over) |
| **pri-** | toward, near | prići (approach) |
| **pro-** | through | proći (pass through) |

### Motion Verb Example: IĆI
ići → **do**ći, **iz**aći, **na**ići, **ob**ići, **ot**ići, **po**ći, **pre**ći, **pri**ći, **pro**ći, **s**ići, **u**ći, **za**ći

name: Word Formation: Suffixes
rule_description:
## Noun-Forming Suffixes

### From Adjectives

| **-ost** | abstract quality | lijep → ljepot**a** |
| **-oća** | quality | čist → čist**oća** |

name: Numerals with Cases
rule_description:
## Number + Noun Agreement

### Basic Rule
| Number | Noun Form | Example |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| 1 | Nom. Sg. | jedan student |
| 2, 3, 4 | Gen. Sg. | dva student**a** |
| 5-20 | Gen. Pl. | pet student**a** |
| 21 | Nom. Sg. | dvadeset jedan student |
| 22-24 | Gen. Sg. | dvadeset dva studenta |
| 25-30 | Gen. Pl. | dvadeset pet studenata |

### Gender of Numbers
| # | Masc | Fem | Neut |
|---|------|-----|------|
| 1 | jedan | jedna | jedno |
| 2 | dva | dvije | dva |
| 3 | tri | tri | tri |
| 4 | četiri | četiri | četiri |

### With Cases (2-4)
| Case | Example |
|------|--------|
| Nom | dva studenta |
| Gen | dva studenta |
| Dat | **dvama** studentima |
| Acc | dva studenta |
| Ins | **dvama** studentima |

name: Collective Numerals
rule_description:
## Collective Numerals (Mixed Groups/Children)

### Forms
| Number | Collective |
|--------|------------|
| 2 | **dvoje** |
| 3 | **troje** |
| 4 | **četvero** |
| 5 | **petero** |
| 6 | **šestero** |
| 7 | **sedmero** |

### Usage
1. **Mixed gender groups:**
   - **Dvoje** djece (two children - mixed)
   - **Troje** prijatelja (three friends - m+f)

2. **Pluralia tantum nouns:**
   - **dvoja** vrata (two doors)
   - **troje** naočale (three glasses)

3. **Abstract counting:**
   - Nas je **petero**. (There are five of us)

### Noun Form After Collective
**Collective numeral** + **Genitive Plural**
- dvoje djec**e** (not djeca)
- troje studenat**a** (mixed group)

name: Indefinite Pronouns
rule_description:
## Indefinite Pronouns (ne- series)

### Basic Forms
| Type | Pronoun | Meaning |
|------|---------|--------|
| Person | **netko** | someone |
| Thing | **nešto** | something |
| Place | **negdje** | somewhere |
| Time | **nekad(a)** | sometime |
| Quality | **nekakav** | some kind of |
| Quantity | **nekoliko** | some/several |

### Declension of Netko
| Case | Form |
|------|------|
| Nom | netko |
| Gen | nekog(a) |
| Dat | nekom(u) |
| Acc | nekog(a) |
| Ins | nekim |

### Neki vs Nekakav
- **neki** = some (specific): neki čovjek
- **nekakav** = some kind of (vague): nekakav problem

### Declension of Neki (like adjective)
| Gender | Nom | Gen | Dat |
|--------|-----|-----|-----|
| M | neki | nekog | nekom |
| F | neka | neke | nekoj |
| N | neko | nekog | nekom |

name: Negative Pronouns
rule_description:
## Negative Pronouns (ni- series)

### Basic Forms
| Type | Pronoun | Meaning |
|------|---------|--------|
| Person | **nitko** | no one |
| Thing | **ništa** | nothing |
| Place | **nigdje** | nowhere |
| Time | **nikad(a)** | never |
| Quality | **nikakav** | no kind of |
| Direction | **nikamo** | to nowhere |

### DOUBLE NEGATIVE Required!
| Croatian | English |
|----------|--------|
| **Nitko ne** dolazi. | Nobody is coming. |
| **Ništa ne** znam. | I don't know anything. |
| **Nikad ne** kasnim. | I never am late. |
| **Nigdje ga ne** vidim. | I don't see him anywhere. |

### Declension of Nitko
| Case | Form |
|------|------|
| Nom | nitko |
| Gen | nikog(a) |
| Dat | nikom(u) |
| Acc | nikog(a) |
| Ins | nikim |

name: Reflexive Possession
rule_description:
## Svoj = One's Own

### Forms (Declines Like Moj)
| Gender | Nom | Gen | Dat | Acc |
|--------|-----|-----|-----|-----|
| Masc | svoj | svog | svom | svoj/svog |
| Fem | svoja | svoje | svojoj | svoju |
| Neut | svoje | svog | svom | svoje |

### When to Use SVOJ
When possessor = subject of the sentence:

| Correct | Incorrect | Meaning |
|---------|-----------|--------|
| On voli **svoju** ženu. | ~~On voli njegovu ženu.~~ | He loves his (own) wife. |
| Ja čitam **svoju** knjigu. | | I read my (own) book. |
| Oni žive u **svojoj** kući. | | They live in their (own) house. |

### When NOT to Use SVOJ
When possessor ≠ subject:

- On voli **njezinu** ženu. (He loves her wife - not his own)
- Vidim **njegovu** kuću. (I see his house)

**Svoj is NEVER in nominative!**

name: Complex Aspect Pairs
rule_description:
## Multiple Perfective Forms from One Imperfective

### Pisati (to write) → Different Perfectives
| Perfective | Meaning | Example |
|------------|---------|--------|
| **na**pisati | write (complete) | Napisao sam pismo. |
| **pre**pisati | copy, rewrite | Prepisao sam tekst. |
| **u**pisati | write in, enroll | Upisao sam se na fakultet. |
| **is**pisati | write out | Ispisao sam sve. |
| **pot**pisati | sign | Potpisao sam ugovor. |
| **za**pisati | write down, note | Zapisao sam broj. |
| **do**pisati | add (writing) | Dopisao sam kraj. |
| **o**pisati | describe | Opisao sam situaciju. |

### Key Insight
Each prefix adds specific meaning:
- **na-** = completion onto surface
- **pre-** = across, re-do
- **u-** = into
- **is-** = out (completely)
- **za-** = behind, begin
- **o-** = around (describing)

name: Motion Verbs (Prefixed)
rule_description:
## IĆI (Go) with Prefixes

| Prefix | Verb | Meaning |
|--------|------|--------|
| **do-** | doći | come (arrive) |
| **ot-** | otići | go away (leave) |
| **iz-** | izaći | go out (exit) |
| **u-** | ući | go in (enter) |
| **na-** | naići | come upon |
| **ob-** | obići | go around |
| **pre-** | prijeći | cross over |
| **pro-** | proći | pass through |
| **pri-** | prići | approach |
| **s-** | sići | go down |
| **uz-** | uzići | go up |
| **za-** | zaći | go behind |

### Conjugation Pattern (Present)
| Verb | Ja | Ti | On |
|------|-----|-----|-----|
| doći | **dođem** | dođeš | dođe |
| ući | **uđem** | uđeš | uđe |
| izaći | **izađem** | izađeš | izađe |

**Note:** All are PERFECTIVE. Imperfective: dolaziti, odlaziti, ulaziti, izlaziti...

name: Conditional in Complex Sentences
rule_description:
## Conditional Sentence Types

### Type 1: Real/Possible (Present/Future)
**Ako** + present, future/present
- **Ako** dođeš, **vidjet ćeš**.
- **Ako** imaš vremena, **dođi**.

### Type 2: Unreal/Hypothetical (Present)
**Kad/Da** + conditional, conditional
- **Kad bih** imao novaca, **kupio bih** auto.
- **Da** sam bogat, **živio bih** u Zagrebu.

### Type 3: Unreal Past (Counterfactual)
**Da** + past, conditional (past)
- **Da sam znao**, **bio bih došao**.
- **Da si me pitao**, **rekao bih** ti.

### Word Order in Conditionals
| Type | Structure |
|------|----------|
| If-clause first | Ako dođeš, vidjet ću te. |
| Main clause first | Vidjet ću te ako dođeš. |

**Key:** Croatian doesn't use conditional in "if" clause (unlike English "would")

name: Subjunctive (Recognition)
rule_description:
## Subjunctive = DA + Present (Literary)

### Structure
**da** + **present tense** (instead of infinitive)

### Common Contexts
| With Verb | Example |
|-----------|--------|
| htjeti | Hoću **da dođeš**. (I want you to come) |
| moći | Možeš **da ideš**. (You can go) |
| trebati | Treba **da radiš**. (You should work) |

### Infinitive vs Da + Present
| Infinitive (standard) | Da + Present (colloquial/regional) |
|-----------------------|------------------------------------|
| Želim **ići**. | Želim **da idem**. |
| Mogu **raditi**. | Mogu **da radim**. |
| Treba **učiti**. | Treba **da učim**. |

### Purpose Clauses
**Da** + present for purpose:
- Došao sam **da te vidim**. (I came to see you)
- Učim **da položim** ispit. (I study to pass)

**Note:** More common in Serbian; in Croatian, infinitive is preferred

name: Pluperfect (Pluskvamperfekt)
rule_description:
## Pluperfect = Had Done (Past before Past)

### Formation
**bio/bila/bili** + **sam/si/je...** + **L-participle**
OR
**bio/bila** + **L-participle** (without auxiliary)

### Full Paradigm
| Person | Form |
|--------|------|
| ja | bio sam radio / bila sam radila |
| ti | bio si radio / bila si radila |
| on | bio je radio |
| ona | bila je radila |
| mi | bili smo radili |
| vi | bili ste radili |
| oni | bili su radili |

### Usage
Action completed BEFORE another past action:

- **Bio sam već otišao** kad je stigao.
  (I had already left when he arrived)
- **Bila je završila** posao prije mene.
  (She had finished work before me)

### Alternative (Common)
Often replaced by simple perfekt with context:
- Već sam otišao kad je stigao.

name: Future Perfect (Futur II)
rule_description:
## Future II = Will Have Done (Future Perfect)

### Formation
**budem/budeš/bude...** + **L-participle**

### Paradigm
| Person | Form |
|--------|------|
| ja | **budem** radio/radila |
| ti | **budeš** radio/radila |
| on/ona | **bude** radio/radila |
| mi | **budemo** radili |
| vi | **budete** radili |
| oni | **budu** radili |

### Usage
Future action BEFORE another future action:

- Kad **budem završio**, javit ću ti se.
  (When I have finished, I'll call you)
- Čim **budeš stigao**, nazovi me.
  (As soon as you arrive, call me)

### Temporal Conjunctions + Futur II
| Conjunction | Example |
|-------------|--------|
| kad | Kad **budem mogao**... |
| čim | Čim **budeš gotov**... |
| nakon što | Nakon što **budem završio**... |
| dok | Dok **ne budeš spreman**... |

name: Reported Speech (Advanced)
rule_description:
## Advanced Reported Speech

### Tense Backshift (Optional in Croatian)
| Direct | Reported (formal) |
|--------|-------------------|
| "Radim." | Rekao je da **radi**. |
| "Radio sam." | Rekao je da je **radio**. |
| "Radit ću." | Rekao je da **će raditi**. |

### Reporting Commands
| Direct | Indirect |
|--------|----------|
| "Dođi!" | Rekao mi je **da dođem**. |
| "Nemoj ići!" | Rekao mi je **da ne idem**. |

### Reporting Questions
| Direct | Indirect |
|--------|----------|
| "Gdje živiš?" | Pitao me **gdje živim**. |
| "Govoriš li...?" | Pitao me **govorim li**... |
| "Hoćeš li doći?" | Pitao me **hoću li doći**. |

### Time/Place Shifts
| Direct | Indirect |
|--------|----------|
| danas | **taj dan** |
| sutra | **sutradan** |
| jučer | **dan prije** |
| ovdje | **tamo** |
| sada | **tada** |

name: Clitic Ordering
rule_description:
## Clitic Order (Strict!)

### Position: After First Stressed Word

### Order Within Clitic Cluster
```
1. LI (question)
2. Auxiliary (sam, si, je, smo, ste, su / ću, ćeš.../ bih, bi...)
3. DATIVE pronoun (mi, ti, mu, joj, nam, vam, im)
4. ACCUSATIVE pronoun (me, te, ga, je/ju, nas, vas, ih)
5. SE (reflexive)
```

### Examples
| Structure | Example |
|-----------|--------|
| Aux + Dat + Acc | **Je li ti ga** dao? |
| Aux + Dat + Se | **Je li ti se** svidjelo? |
| Aux + Acc + Se | Ovo **mi se** sviđa. |

### Full Example
- Hoće**š li mi ga** dati?
  (Will you give it to me?)
  = li + ćeš → hoćeš li + mi (dat) + ga (acc)

### Never First!
Clitics NEVER start a sentence:
- ~~Mi se sviđa~~ → **Sviđa mi se.**
- ~~Ga vidim~~ → **Vidim ga.**

name: Enclitic vs Full Forms
rule_description:
## Short (Clitic) vs Full Pronoun Forms

### Pronoun Forms
| Person | Clitic (Acc) | Full (Acc) | Clitic (Dat) | Full (Dat) |
|--------|--------------|------------|--------------|------------|
| ja | me | **mene** | mi | **meni** |
| ti | te | **tebe** | ti | **tebi** |
| on | ga | **njega** | mu | **njemu** |
| ona | je/ju | **nju** | joj | **njoj** |
| mi | nas | **nas** | nam | **nama** |
| vi | vas | **vas** | vam | **vama** |
| oni | ih | **njih** | im | **njima** |

### When to Use Full Forms
1. **Emphasis/Contrast:**
   - **Njega** vidim, ne tebe.

2. **After prepositions:**
   - Za **njega**. S **njom**.

3. **Sentence-initial:**
   - **Meni** se sviđa. (emphatic)

4. **Standing alone:**
   - Tko? **Ja.**

name: Verbal Aspect with Negation
rule_description:
## Aspect Choice in Negative Sentences

### Imperfective Preferred in Negation
| Affirmative (Perf) | Negative (Imperf) |
|--------------------|-------------------|
| Pročitao sam. | **Nisam čitao.** |
| Napisao sam. | **Nisam pisao.** |
| Naučio sam. | **Nisam učio.** |

### Why?
Negation often denies the ACTION (process), not the result.

### Exceptions
Perfective negation = strong denial of specific result:
- **Nisam napisao** to pismo. (I didn't write THAT letter)
- **Nisam pročitao** članak. (I haven't read the article)

### Imperatives: Always Imperfective in Negative
| Positive | Negative |
|----------|----------|
| Napiši! (Perf) | **Nemoj pisati!** (Imperf) |
| Pročitaj! (Perf) | **Nemoj čitati!** (Imperf) |
| Pojedi! (Perf) | **Nemoj jesti!** (Imperf) |

**Rule:** Negative commands use IMPERFECTIVE

name: Impersonal Constructions
rule_description:
## Impersonal (Subjectless) Sentences

### With SE
| Pattern | Example | Meaning |
|---------|---------|--------|
| Verb + se | **Govori se** da... | It's said that... |
| | **Radi se** o... | It's about... |
| | **Može se** vidjeti | One can see |
| | **Tu se** dobro jede | One eats well here |

### With TREBA
| Pattern | Meaning |
|---------|--------|
| **Treba** + infinitive | One should/must |
| **Treba** + noun (Nom) | ...is needed |
| **Treba** mi + noun (Gen) | I need... |

Examples:
- **Treba raditi.** (One should work)
- **Treba strpljenja.** (Patience is needed)
- **Treba mi pomoć.** (I need help)

### Weather & States
| Expression | Meaning |
|------------|--------|
| **Pada** kiša. | It's raining. |
| **Hladno** je. | It's cold. |
| **Kasno** je. | It's late. |
| **Teško** mi je. | I feel bad/hard. |

name: Nominalization Patterns
rule_description:
## Verb → Noun Patterns

### From Infinitive
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| -anje | čitati → čit**anje** |
| -enje | učiti → uč**enje** |
| -ća | pomoći → pomo**ć** |

### Adjective → Noun
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| -ost | lijep → ljep**ota** |
| -oća | čist → čist**oća** |
| -ina | vis**ok** → vis**ina** |
| -stvo | bogat → bog**atstvo** |

### Abstract Nouns from Verbs
| Verb | Abstract Noun |
|------|---------------|
| živjeti | živ**ot** (life) |
| raditi | rad (work) |
| misliti | mis**ao** (thought) |
| osjećati | osjeć**aj** (feeling) |

### Usage in Formal Style
- **Čitanje** knjiga je važno.
- **Razumijevanje** problema zahtijeva...
- Nakon **završetka** posla...

name: Advanced Relative Clauses
rule_description:
## Advanced Relative Pronouns

### Čiji (Whose)
| Gender | Form |
|--------|------|
| Masc | čiji |
| Fem | čija |
| Neut | čije |

Example: Čovjek **čija** je kuća...

### Kakav (What Kind Of)
Agrees with antecedent:
- ...knjiga **kakvu** volim
- ...čovjek **kakav** je on

### Restrictive vs Non-Restrictive
| Type | Punctuation | Example |
|------|-------------|--------|
| Restrictive | no comma | Student koji uči uspjet će. |
| Non-restrictive | comma | Ana, koja živi u Zagrebu, dolazi. |

### Relative Adverbs
| Word | Usage |
|------|-------|
| **gdje** | ...grad gdje živim |
| **kamo** | ...mjesto kamo idem |
| **odakle** | ...grad odakle dolazim |
| **kad(a)** | ...dan kad sam stigao |

### Što vs Koji
- **Što** = less formal, refers to whole clause
- **Koji** = standard, refers to specific noun

name: Purpose & Result Clauses
rule_description:
## Purpose Clauses (In Order To)

### DA + Present
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| **da** + present | Učim **da položim**. |
| | Došao sam **da te vidim**. |

### KAKO BI + L-Participle (Formal)
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| **kako bih** | ...kako bih mogao... |
| **kako bi** | ...kako bi razumio... |

### RADI + Genitive
- **Radi** boljeg života. (For a better life)

## Result Clauses (So That)

### TAKO DA + Indicative
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| tako da | Učio je **tako da** je položio. |
| | Kiša je padala **tako da** nismo mogli izaći. |

### Distinction
| Purpose (intention) | Result (outcome) |
|--------------------|------------------|
| Učim **da položim**. | Učio sam **tako da** sam položio. |
| (I study to pass) | (I studied so that I passed) |

name: Concessive Clauses
rule_description:
## Concessive = Although/Despite

### IAKO (Although)
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| **iako** + indicative | **Iako** je kasno, radim. |
| | **Iako** sam umoran, nastavit ću. |

### PREMDA (Although - Formal)
- **Premda** je teško, uspjet će.

### MAKAR (Even If)
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| **makar** + past | **Makar** bio bolestan, došao je. |
| **ma** + imperative | **Ma** što rekao... |

### BEZ OBZIRA NA + Acc (Regardless Of)
- **Bez obzira na** vrijeme, idemo.

### UNATOČ + Dat (Despite)
- **Unatoč** lošem vremenu, izašli smo.

### Concessive with MA-
| Pattern | Meaning |
|---------|--------|
| **ma koliko** | however much |
| **ma kakav** | whatever kind |
| **ma tko** | whoever |
| **ma gdje** | wherever |

name: Temporal Clauses (Complex)
rule_description:
## Temporal Conjunctions

### Simultaneous
| Conj | Meaning | Example |
|------|---------|--------|
| **dok** | while | **Dok** čitam, slušam glazbu. |
| **kad(a)** | when | **Kad** dođem, javim se. |

### Sequential
| Conj | Meaning | Example |
|------|---------|--------|
| **čim** | as soon as | **Čim** stignem... |
| **pošto** | after | **Pošto** je završio... |
| **nakon što** | after | **Nakon što** smo jeli... |
| **prije nego** | before | **Prije nego** što odeš... |
| **otkad** | since (time) | **Otkad** je došao... |

### With Future (Futur II)
| Conj + Futur II | Example |
|-----------------|--------|
| Kad **budem mogao**... | When I can... |
| Čim **budeš stigao**... | As soon as you arrive... |

### DOK NE (Until)
- Čekaj **dok ne dođem**. (Wait until I come)
- Uses perfective + ne

name: Cause & Reason Clauses
rule_description:
## Causal Conjunctions

### Common Conjunctions
| Conj | Register | Example |
|------|----------|--------|
| **jer** | neutral | Idem **jer** moram. |
| **zato što** | neutral | ...zato što volim. |
| **budući da** | formal | **Budući da** je kasno... |
| **pošto** | neutral | **Pošto** nema vremena... |
| **kako** | formal | **Kako** je bio umoran... |
| **s obzirom da** | formal | **S obzirom da**... |

### Position
| First | Second |
|-------|--------|
| **Jer** je kasno, idem. | Idem **jer** je kasno. |
| **Zato što** volim... | ...zato što volim. |

### ZBOG + Genitive (Because Of)
- **Zbog** kiše, ostali smo doma.
- **Zbog** tebe, kasnimo.

### Difference: JER vs ZATO ŠTO
- **Jer** = gives reason (why)
- **Zato što** = explains cause (because of which)

name: Comparison Clauses
rule_description:
## Comparison Structures

### KAO (Like/As)
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| **kao** + Nom | Visok **kao** ja. |
| **kao što** + clause | **Kao što** sam rekao... |
| **kao da** + clause | **Kao da** ne zna. (as if) |

### NEGO (Than - After Comparative)
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| Comp + **nego** + Nom | Stariji **nego** ja. |
| Comp + **od** + Gen | Stariji **od** mene. |
| **nego što** + clause | Bolje **nego što** misliš. |

### KOLIKO...TOLIKO (As Much As)
- **Koliko** znam, **toliko** govorim.

### ŠTO...TO (The More...The More)
- **Što** više učim, **to** bolje znam.
- **Što** prije, **to** bolje.

### Equality
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| **jednako** kao | Jednako visok kao ti. |
| **isto** kao | Isto kao ti. |

name: Stylistic Word Order
rule_description:
## Marked Word Order for Emphasis

### Neutral vs Emphatic
| Neutral (SVO) | Emphatic |
|---------------|----------|
| Ivan čita knjigu. | **Knjigu** čita Ivan. |
| Vidio sam ga. | **Njega** sam vidio. |
| Kupio sam auto. | **Auto** sam kupio. |

### Fronting Rules
1. **Topic fronting:** Known info first
   - (O tom) **O tome** ćemo poslije.

2. **Focus fronting:** New/important info first
   - **Meni** se to sviđa. (It's ME who likes it)

3. **Contrast:** Emphasized element first
   - **On** je došao, ne ja.

### Inversion
| Standard | Inverted (literary) |
|----------|---------------------|
| Lijepa je. | **Lijepa** je ona. |
| Rekao sam. | **Rekoh** ja. (archaic) |

### End Focus
New information at sentence end:
- Dao sam knjigu **Ani**. (to Ana, not someone else)

name: Calques & False Friends
rule_description:
## False Friends (Croatian vs English)

### Common Errors
| English | Wrong Croatian | Correct Croatian |
|---------|----------------|------------------|
| actually | ~~aktualno~~ | zapravo, ustvari |
| eventually | ~~eventualno~~ | na kraju, konačno |
| prospect | ~~prospekt~~ | izgled, perspektiva |
| billion | ~~bilijun~~ | milijarda |
| chef | ~~šef~~ | kuhar |
| sympathetic | ~~simpatičan~~ | suosjećajan |

### Anglicisms to Avoid
| Anglicism | Correct Croatian |
|-----------|------------------|
| ~~printati~~ | ispisati, tiskati |
| ~~downloadati~~ | preuzeti |
| ~~emailati~~ | poslati e-mail |

### Calque Structures
| English Pattern | Wrong | Correct |
|-----------------|-------|--------|
| make sense | ~~ima smisla~~ | ima smisla ✓ |
| have a look | ~~imati pogled~~ | pogledati |
| take place | ~~uzeti mjesto~~ | održati se |

**Tip:** When in doubt, use native Croatian expression

name: Stylistic Syntax
rule_description:
## Literary Word Order & Stylistic Effects

### Verb-First (Literary Inversion)
| Standard | Literary |
|----------|----------|
| On reče. | **Reče** on. |
| Sunce je izašlo. | **Izađe** sunce. |

### Adjective Postposition (Archaic/Poetic)
| Standard | Poetic |
|----------|--------|
| lijepa žena | žena **lijepa** |
| stara kuća | kuća **stara** |

### Object Fronting (Topicalization)
- **Njega** nikad nisam volio.
- **To** ti ne mogu obećati.

### Parenthetical Insertion
- On je, **kako sam čuo**, stigao.
- Rekla je, **navodno**, istinu.

### Cleft Sentences (Emphasis)
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| To je X koji... | **To je on** koji je nazvao. |
| Ono što... | **Ono što** želim je mir. |

**Register:** These patterns appear in literature, journalism, formal speeches

name: Archaisms (Recognition)
rule_description:
## Archaic Grammar (Passive Recognition)

### Old Verb Forms
| Modern | Archaic | Context |
|--------|---------|--------|
| bih | **bjeh** | literary |
| reče | **rekoh** (aorist) | formal/literary |
| bijaše | **bješe** | folk tales |

### Old Case Endings
| Modern | Archaic |
|--------|--------|
| prijatelja (gen pl) | prijatelj**â** |
| u kući | u kući / u dom**u** |
| dvaju | dvij**u** |

### Archaic Vocabulary
| Archaic | Modern |
|---------|--------|
| **tkogod** | netko |
| **ino** | drugo |
| **nuđ** | ponuda |
| **cjelov** | poljubac |

### Where Found
- Croatian literature (pre-1990)
- Folk poetry and songs
- Religious texts
- Legal documents (formal)
- Proverbs and sayings

**Purpose:** Recognition only; don't use actively

name: Dialectal Variation (Awareness)
rule_description:
## Croatian Dialect Groups

### Three Main Dialects (by "what" word)
| Dialect | "What" | Region |
|---------|--------|--------|
| **Štokavski** | što | Standard Croatian |
| **Kajkavski** | kaj | Zagreb region, north |
| **Čakavski** | ča | Coast, islands |

### Kajkavian Features
| Standard | Kajkavian |
|----------|----------|
| što | **kaj** |
| ja sam | **ja sem** |
| kuća | **hiža** |
| govoriti | **govoreti** |

### Čakavian Features
| Standard | Čakavian |
|----------|----------|
| što | **ča** |
| mi | **mi** (different intonation) |
| tjedan | **šetemana** |
| more | reduced vowels |

### Ikavian vs Ijekavian (within Štokavian)
| Ekavian (Serbian) | Ijekavian (Croatian) | Ikavian |
|-------------------|---------------------|--------|
| mleko | mlij**e**ko | ml**i**ko |
| reka | rij**e**ka | r**i**ka |

**Standard Croatian = Štokavian + Ijekavian**

name: Formal Written Croatian
rule_description:
## Official/Administrative Language

### Formal Vocabulary
| Informal | Formal |
|----------|--------|
| dobiti | **zaprimiti** |
| dati | **uručiti, dostaviti** |
| reći | **izvijestiti, obavijestiti** |
| pitati | **zamoliti, zatražiti** |

### Legal Phrases
| Phrase | Meaning |
|--------|--------|
| **sukladno** + Dat | in accordance with |
| **temeljem** + Gen | on the basis of |
| **u svezi s** + Inst | in connection with |
| **s obzirom na** + Acc | with regard to |
| **u skladu s** + Inst | in line with |

### Document Structure
| Section | Purpose |
|---------|--------|
| **Predmet:** | Subject |
| **Poziv na:** | Reference |
| **S poštovanjem,** | Respectfully, |
| **U prilogu:** | Attached: |

### Passive Preferred
- **Zahtjev je zaprimljen.** (not Mi smo zaprimili...)
- **Odluka će biti donesena.** (not Donijet ćemo...)

name: Journalistic Style
rule_description:
## News Writing Conventions

### Headline Grammar
- Omit auxiliary verbs: **Premijer stigao** (not je stigao)
- Present for past: **Vlada donosi odluku**
- Nominalized verbs: **Usvajanje zakona**

### Lead Paragraph (5W+H)
| Question | Croatian |
|----------|----------|
| Who | **Tko** |
| What | **Što** |
| When | **Kada** |
| Where | **Gdje** |
| Why | **Zašto** |
| How | **Kako** |

### Attribution
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| Direct quote | "Tekst," **rekao je** ministar. |
| Indirect | Ministar je **izjavio da**... |
| According to | **Prema riječima** + Gen |
| As reported | **Kako javlja/prenosi** |

### Formal Phrases
| Phrase | Usage |
|--------|-------|
| navodno | allegedly |
| prema neslužbenim izvorima | according to unofficial sources |
| potvrđeno je | it has been confirmed |

name: Academic Writing
rule_description:
## Academic Croatian

### Impersonal Constructions
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| Passive | **Analizirani su** podaci. |
| 1st pl. (we) | U ovom radu **razmatramo**... |
| Impersonal | **Može se zaključiti da**... |

### Hedging Expressions
| Certainty | Expression |
|-----------|------------|
| Strong | **jasno je da**, **očito** |
| Medium | **čini se da**, **izgleda** |
| Weak | **možda**, **moguće je** |

### Citation & Reference
| Pattern | Example |
|---------|--------|
| According to | **Prema** Horvat (2020)... |
| States that | Autor **navodi da**... |
| In contrast | **Za razliku od** + Gen |
| Similarly | **Slično tomu**, **Također** |

### Thesis Structure Terms
| Croatian | English |
|----------|--------|
| uvod | introduction |
| metodologija | methodology |
| rezultati | results |
| rasprava | discussion |
| zaključak | conclusion |
| literatura | references |

name: Euphemism & Taboo
rule_description:
## Polite Alternatives & Social Conventions

### Death
| Direct | Euphemism |
|--------|----------|
| umrijeti | **preminuti**, **otići** |
| mrtav | **pokojni** |
| ubiti | **lišiti života** |
| samoubojstvo | **oduzeti si život** |

### Bodily Functions

name: Irony & Sarcasm Markers
rule_description:
## Recognizing Non-Literal Meaning

### Linguistic Markers
| Marker | Example |
|--------|--------|
| **baš** (emphatic) | **Baš** si pametan! (You're SO smart!) |
| **jako** (very) | **Jako** zanimljivo. (Very interesting.) |
| **divno** (wonderful) | **Divno**, još kiša. |

### Intonation Cues
- Exaggerated stress
- Flat/monotone delivery
- Pause before key word

### Common Ironic Phrases
| Phrase | Literal | Ironic meaning |
|--------|---------|----------------|
| Hvala lijepo. | Thanks nicely | Thanks for nothing |
| Ma nemoj! | Don't say! | Tell me something I don't know |
| Odlično! | Excellent! | (Context-dependent) |
| Baš me briga. | I really care | I don't care at all |

### Quotation Marks (Written)
- Ti si "stručnjak". (You're an "expert")
- "Lijepo" si se ponašao. (You behaved "nicely")

**Key:** Context + tone + relationship between speakers

name: Hedging & Mitigation
rule_description:

| Daj mi | **Bilo bi lijepo da mi daš** |

### Hedging Expressions
| Type | Expressions |
|------|-------------|
| Probability | **vjerojatno**, **možda**, **moguće** |
| Approximation | **otprilike**, **približno**, **nekih** |
| Attribution | **koliko znam**, **prema meni** |
| Tentativeness | **reklo bi se**, **moglo bi se** |

### Downtoners
- **malo** (a bit): malo kasniš
- **pomalo** (somewhat): pomalo čudno
- **donekle** (to some extent): donekle točno
